channel.title: Solution to .txt/sql dilemna :)
channel.description:
If you think about it its really an easy solution, we make it both :)
Its really easy to do, I think the best way to handle it would be to make a class to handle reading of the info, and so the current procedures (for example loadDialogues or loadDrops) would just call the new class like: readinfo(string) and depending on the boolean that was set when you started the server it would either readfrom/writeto a sql db or a .txt file, that way you can use either or, and it wont be much code modification at all ;)
as soon as I look at the sql based server code, I should be able to start porting it over to make it work, what do you guys think? :D
(oh, and the way we choose bewtween using sql or txt is a simple parameter, like
[code]java -cp . server sql[/code]
or
[code]java -cp . server txt[/code]
and if you sent in no parameter we would set the default as txt

item.title: Solution to .txt/sql dilemna :)

@silabsoft wrote:

good idea either or i like it

item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

you dont understand rictoo, its not a different hybridscape, its the same one with simply an option for mysql or txt, everything else will be the same, thats the point

Read full topic

item.title: Solution to .txt/sql dilemna :)
item.dc:creator: @Rictoo Rictoo
item.description:
@Rictoo wrote:

Sure, I’ll make a new folder in the CVS for HybridscapeTXT

So when you commit make sure the module is called hybridscapetxt (All lowercase)
We don’t want you overwriting our normal hybridscape

Read full topic
